docs.title: Jhonatan — Data Science Roadmap
docs.text:
Welcome. This is a book‑style roadmap that balances applied mathematics, practical machine learning, NLP/LLMs, and deployment discipline.

Use the Roadmap section to navigate week by week, the Resources to find books and documentation, and Projects to track deliverables and metrics.

Principle: Roadmap as code. Everything here is versioned, reproducible, and measurable.

docs.title: Projects
docs.text:
Phase projects and capstone live here. Each project should include a short readme, metrics, and pointers to the associated weeks.

  • Phase 1: Ethical Baseline (Week 8)
  • Phase 2: Defensible Tabular Model (Week 16)
  • Phase 3: Forecasting with Guardrails (Week 24)
  • Phase 4: Production‑Ready Inference (Week 32)
  • Capstone (Week 40)

docs.title: Key Bibliography
docs.text:
A curated list of books, lectures, and long‑form references used throughout the roadmap.

  • Python Data Science Handbook — Jake VanderPlas — https://jakevdp.github.io/PythonDataScienceHandbook/
  • Fluent Python (2e) — Luciano Ramalho — O’Reilly
  • ISLR2 (Python) — James, Witten, Hastie, Tibshirani — https://www.statlearning.com/
  • The Elements of Statistical Learning — Hastie, Tibshirani, Friedman — free PDF
  • Introduction to Probability (Stat 110) — Blitzstein & Hwang
  • Forecasting: Principles and Practice (FPP3) — Hyndman & Athanasopoulos
  • Deep Learning — Goodfellow, Bengio, Courville
  • Dive into Deep Learning (D2L) — interactive notebooks
  • Speech and Language Processing (3e draft) — Jurafsky & Martin
  • Designing Data‑Intensive Applications — Martin Kleppmann

docs.title: Datasets
docs.text:
• UCI / OpenML tabular datasets (Titanic, Adult Income, Housing)
  • 20 Newsgroups, IMDb, AG News for text
  • GLUE/SQuAD for supervised NLP
  • Public time series (energy, retail, traffic) for forecasting

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text: Below is the full journey. Each week page contains: Code focus, Math & stats, Bibliography, Docs, Project, and a Summary with concrete goals.

docs.title: Capstone
docs.text: • Week 40 — TBD — see syllabus

docs.title: Code focus
docs.text: VS Code + Jupyter/Colab; Poetry/venv; NumPy arrays and broadcasting; pandas vs Polars; scikit‑learn Pipeline & ColumnTransformer; simple linear/logistic baseline.

docs.title: Math & stats
docs.text: Populations vs samples; mean/median/quantiles; standardisation and z‑scores; vector norms; why vectorisation improves asymptotics.

docs.title: Bibliography (specific)
docs.text:
• Jake VanderPlas, Python Data Science Handbook (O’Reilly, free online)
  • Luciano Ramalho, Fluent Python (2e, O’Reilly) — Parts I–II

docs.title: Docs (official)
docs.text:
• NumPy Quickstart
  • pandas User Guide
  • Polars User Guide
  • scikit‑learn Getting Started (Pipeline, ColumnTransformer)

docs.title: Project
docs.text: Title: Data Diary & Honest Baseline Dataset: Three small UCI/OpenML CSVs (Titanic, Adult Income, California Housing). Targets/metrics: Reproducible row counts; no missing values post‑transform; baseline Accuracy/ROC‑AUC or MAE/RMSE; unit tests pass.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Establish a frictionless workflow and a leakage‑free baseline. This template will be reused throughout the roadmap.

Checklist - [ ] Code daily (≥60 min) - [ ] Math/stats micro (20–30 min) - [ ] Reading (10–20 min) - [ ] Push MLflow runs - [ ] Update progress

docs.title: Code focus
docs.text: Imputation (Simple/KNN); OneHotEncoder/OrdinalEncoder; robust summaries with Pingouin; stratified train/validation splitting; leakage checks.

docs.title: Math & stats
docs.text: Quantiles, IQR, Winsorising; non‑parametric tests; multiple comparisons (Bonferroni).

docs.title: Bibliography (specific)
docs.text:
• ISLR2 (Python), Ch. 2–3 — James et al.
  • Pingouin documentation (effect sizes and tests)

docs.title: Docs (official)
docs.text:
• scikit‑learn preprocessing
  • SciPy stats
  • statsmodels overview

docs.title: Project
docs.text: Title: Clean to Win Dataset: Titanic or Adult Income (UCI/Kaggle). Targets/metrics: Balanced accuracy, PR‑AUC if imbalanced; data‑contract tests pass.

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Show that careful cleaning and encoding produce stronger baselines than exotic models.

Checklist - [ ] Code daily (≥60 min) - [ ] Math/stats micro (20–30 min) - [ ] Reading (10–20 min) - [ ] Push MLflow runs - [ ] Update progress

docs.title: Weeks 03–40
docs.text:
This page collects links to all remaining weeks. Replace the placeholders in docs/data/weeks.yaml to render full content automatically.

  • Week 03 — create docs/roadmap/week-03.md with `## Week 03 — TBD — see syllabus

Checklist - [ ] Code daily (≥60 min) - [ ] Math/stats micro (20–30 min) - [ ] Reading (10–20 min) - [ ] Push MLflow runs - [ ] Update progress ` - ... - Week 40 — create corresponding page

Tip: copy docs/roadmap/week-01.md and change the number.
